page.title: 01NW from Wincanton, Somerset
page.content: A section of landscape which is typical of SE Somerset. Rolling verdant hills, a patchwork of smallish fields most of them outlined by healthy hedgerows containing many good trees, is the overall impression. The lanes are narrow and twisting and meander across the area between high hedgerows. The land, for the most part, is well cultivated but there are a few small pockets of rough ground fit only for grazing. There is some woodland and, closer to the town, a horticultural nursery is doing well. We have a National Hunt racecourse which, with its attendant good facilities, serves both the local and area needs. It has a Function Suite and touring caravan site. It is also used as the town's "open space" for markets, fund-raising, walking the dog etc.
